headers: REFERENCE DECK — JASON SHUMAN / PRIMARY VC

rows.REFERENCE DECK — JASON SHUMAN / PRIMARY: Why this is here: Good deck reference model. Shuman builds real companies, not slides.

rows.col_2: Jason Shuman, General Partner @ Primary Venture Partners
Primary VC — NYC-based seed fund, ~$200M AUM
Hardware, Vertical AI, Vertical Integrators, Marketplaces, Built World, Fintech
Forbes 30 Under 30 VC, former DTC founder (footwear), former Uber driver while sourcing deals. Founder-turned-investor ethos.

rows.REFERENCE DECK — JASON SHUMAN / PRIMARY: WHY THIS IS A GOOD DECK

rows.col_2: Opens with the paradigm shift (Head-Worn Intelligence Era), not product features
rows.col_3: Open with 'electrolyte market is broken for X reason' — thesis before product

rows.col_2: Defines a new category ('head-worn intelligence') rather than competing in existing one
rows.col_3: IonWave isn't 'another electrolyte' — define the category we're creating

rows.col_2: Backs every claim with specific metrics, market data, not vibes
rows.col_3: Every slide needs a number. No hand-waving.

rows.col_2: Tells a story that investors can retell to their LPs
rows.col_3: The IonWave story needs to be retellable in 30 seconds

rows.col_2: Shuman is a former founder — he speaks operator language
rows.col_3: Our deck should speak operator, not MBA

rows.col_2: $100K-$3M sweet spot — knows exactly who he's building for
rows.col_3: Our deck should know exactly who we're raising from and at what check size

rows.col_2: Shuman has said deck designers quote $20-40K — the deck isn't the business
rows.col_3: The Trade IS the business. Deck is just the door opener.
What changed in the world that makes this inevitable NOW
Who has this problem and how badly — with data
What we figured out that nobody else has
What we built and how it works
rows.col_4: Demo or visual, not bullet points

rows.col_3: What we've done, metrics, organic reach
How we make money, unit economics
Why we win and others don't
Why this team, why now, unfair advantages
How much, what for, what milestones
rows.col_4: Specific use of funds → specific outcomes

rows.REFERENCE DECK — JASON SHUMAN / PRIMARY: Primary VC differentiator: Portfolio Impact team — full-time execs in the trenches with founders
Shuman evaluates: sense of urgency, grit, speed of learning, resourcefulness, ability to sell
Red flags per Shuman: founders who don't know their metrics, don't know industry acronyms, good storytellers but no depth
Shuman's advice: raise capital NOW, don't wait — tidal wave of companies competing for limited capital
Connection to Vicioso model: Shuman's approach maps to ACP grading — Attestation (do you know your numbers?), Completeness (have you done the work?), Plausibility (can you actually execute?)
